briefTitle: An Open-Label Study to Compare the Lipid Effects of Niacin ER and Simvastatin (NS) to Atorvastatin in Subjects With Hyperlipidemia or Mixed Dyslipidemia (SUPREME)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects must meet all of the following laboratory criteria:

  * HDL-C \<40 mg/dL for men and \<50 mg/dL for women.
  * LDL-C â‰¥130 mg/dL but \<250 mg/dL.
  * TG \<350 mg/dL.
  * Creatine phosphokinase (CPK) \< 3 x upper limit of normal (ULN).
  * Alanine aminotransferase (ALT); serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase \[SGPT\] and aspartate aminotransferase (AST); serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase \[SGOT\] \< 1.3 x ULN.
* Subjects must also be reasonably compliant with the Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes (TLC) diet during the 4 to 5 week Screening Period prior to randomization (and be willing to comply for the duration of the study).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subjects who have a history of any important medical conditions or abnormalities (as specified in the protocol) that would preclude study inclusion

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 HDL-C minus baseline HDL-C) x 100/baseline HDL-C

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in HDL-C From Baseline to Week 8
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 8 HDL-C minus baseline HDL-C) x 100/baseline HDL-C

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Non-HDL-C From Baseline to Week 8
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 8 non-HDL-C minus baseline non-HDL-C) x 100/baseline non-HDL-C

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Non-HDL-C From Baseline to Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 non-HDL-C minus baseline non-HDL-C) x 100/baseline non-HDL-C

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) From Baseline to Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 LDL-C minus baseline LDL-C) x 100/baseline LDL-C

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Triglycerides From Baseline to Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 triglycerides minus baseline triglycerides) x 100/baseline triglycerides

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in LDL-C:HDL-C Ratio
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 LDL-C:HDL-C ratio minus baseline LDL-C:HDL-C ratio) x 100/baseline LDL-C:HDL-C ratio

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 total cholesterol minus baseline total cholesterol) x 100/baseline total cholesterol

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Total Cholesterol:HDL-C Ratio
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 total cholesterol:HDL-C ratio minus baseline total cholesterol:HDL-C ratio) x 100/baseline total cholesterol:HDL-C ratio

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Lipoprotein A From Baseline to Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: (Week 12 lipoprotein A minus baseline lipoprotein A) x 100/baseline lipoprotein A

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Meeting With HDL-C >/= 40 mg/dL at Week 12
Percentage of Subjects Meeting National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Panel (NCEP ATP) III Goal for LDL-C at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: For high-risk patients (coronary heart disease or equivalent), LDL-C \< 100 mg/dL and non-HDL-C \< 130 mg/dL; for moderate risk patients (having 2 risk factors), LDL-C \< 130 mg/dL and non-HDL-C \< 160 mg/dL; for low-risk patients (having 0 or 1 risk factor): LDL-C \< 160 mg/dL and non-HDL-C \< 190 mg/dL.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects With Triglycerides < 150 mg/dL at Week 12
Percentage of Subjects With HDL-C >/= 40 mg/dL, LDL-C Meeting NCEP ATP III Goal, and Triglycerides < 150 mg/dL at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: NCEP ATP III goals for LDL-C are as follows: For high-risk patients, LDL-C \< 100 mg/dL; for moderate risk patients, LDL-C \< 130 mg/dL; for low-risk patients: LDL-C \< 160 mg/dL. High-risk means coronary heart disease or risk equivalents; moderate risk means having at least 2 risk factors; low-risk means having no or 1 risk factor.
